# jest/no-test-return-statement <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
</div>

### What it does

Disallow explicitly returning from tests.

### Why is this bad?

Tests in Jest should be void and not return values.
If you are returning Promises then you should update the test to use
`async/await`.

### Example

```javascript
test("one", () => {
  return expect(1).toBe(1);
});
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny jest/no-test-return-statement --jest-plugin
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "plugins": ["jest"],
  "rules": {
    "jest/no-test-return-statement": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
